review: From a pure viewing experience, the unit works as expected. It was VERY easy to set up and get going-plus it was $20 off for the Holiday. For my Nexflix account, however, the interface is cumbersome. So, I went on the Netflix website on my laptop. I picked the shows I was interested in and can now find them easily on my list. I also did that for Prime viewing, makes it easier to find what I want that is Prime eligible. This unit was a whole lot less expensive than replacing my TV, and that was reason enough for me to try it. The voice search is also a bonus...works great!

review: very impress with the quality of programs in HD. But still confused on what channels are available to watch with out a cable/satellite provider. Some apps/channels you have to have dish or directv or some other subscription service to watch. That was a disappointment. You really have to keep some sort of subscription to get channels and I have  not figured out networks yet. There is very little information out there on what is really going on. I do like it for some really neat app that are FREE. Yoga, art, and of course Netflix,Amazon, Hulu and a number of movie/tv offerings. Another great thing are the reviews. They do help you from wasting your time downloading. I would say do your research, but there does not seem to be anyone out there that can give us the 101 on streaming tv. I believe it is the future, we are just a little early.
